results.title: Welcome to my home
results.brief_description: Traces the history of the Aboriginal people of Weipa South since the time white men first arrived in 1606. The early influence of church and government is shown using historic footage and interviews with Aboriginal community leaders. Examines Aboriginal life there today and the interaction with the European settlement, which was established at Weipa to mine the bauxite deposit.

results.title: Victoria's Energy
results.creator_credit: Dept of Minerals and Energy AV Workshop
results.brief_description:
“Victoria’s energy” uses stills to analyse Victoria’s energy position during 1980-81.

See also Related Title “Energy conservation in the home” which provides useful information on the ways in which energy can be saved within the household.

results.title: The Work That Was. Parts 1 & 2
results.brief_description: Who Pays the Price? (Sydney, 1979, 30 min.): Looks at the possible social effects of technological change in the context of Australia’s economic system. “Futures” (Sydney, 1979, 30 min.): Looks at the decline of labour intensive manufacturing industries in Australia, unemployment in country towns, and the prospects of the coming mineral boom.

results.title: TV50 Celebrity Interviews
results.creator_credit: ACMI Content Development, Astrid Scott and ACMI
results.brief_description: Interviews with thirteen celebrities from Australian television. Asked the same questions, their responses are recorded vox pop style. Questions asked concern the celebrities’ experiences of television both as a viewer and as a personality and performer as well as their thoughts on reality television and the state of Australian television in general. Interviews were conducted at ACMI for the TV50 exhibition in 2006.

results.title: Once Upon a Cheese
results.creator_credit: John Richardson, Hugh Stuckey and Kestrel Film Productions
results.brief_description: A light-hearted look at the cheese industry in Australia today. Shows how cheese is made by a fully automated process. Points out that special factories have been set up to produce cheddar. Lists the different types of cheeses - all of which are now available in Australia. Touches upon the varieties to be used with wines and beer, in cooking and how to store cheese at home.

results.title: Every Inch Australian
results.creator_credit: Roland Litchfield, ACTIL and Litchfield Films
results.brief_description: Gives a complete picture of processes used in the manufacture of cotton sheeting at the Actil plant at Woodville, South Australia. Emphasis is placed on the scientific control and checking of all production processes from the arrival of bales of raw cotton to the final packing of Actil products and their despatch to all parts of Australia.

results.title: Going Our Way
results.creator_credit: Chris Gallagher, Crawford Productions and Victorian Railways
results.brief_description: Presents the many employment opportunities in the Victorian Railways. A young boy playing with his toys, including a train, dreams of his future. He becomes a station assistant. Shows how he learns his job and benefits from the V.R.I. library and sporting clubs. Includes executive officers who started at the bottom and worked their way to the top.

results.title: A Moving Picture
results.creator_credit: John M. Bale and Tasfilm Productions
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the operation of air, sea, road and rail services in Tasmania, the important part they play in the State’s economy and the use made of them by local industries.
